intro: Cissus poilanei, commonly known as the Madagascar grape ivy, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Cissus poilanei thrives in humid, tropical conditions and is often grown as an ornamental plant.
